statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Devin Sibley scored 23 points and Furman made five of six free throws in the last 34 seconds to hold off Mercer 71-69 on Monday night.
article.headline: Sibley scores 23, Furman holds off Mercer 71-67 in SoCon
article.linkText: Sibley scores 23, Furman holds off Mercer 71-67 in SoCon
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Devin Sibley scored 23 points and Furman made five of six free throws in the last 34 seconds to hold off Mercer 71-69 on Monday night. The game was Sibley's sixth 20-point total this season for the Paladins (9-6, 2-0 Southern Conference). Matt Rafferty added 14 points and Daniel Fowler 13. Furman scored 22 points from the free throw line, Rafferty making six of seven attempts. Jordan Strawberry led Mercer (6-9, 0-2) with a season-high 23 points and twice pulled the Bears within a point late in the game -- hitting a jumper to make it 63-62 and a 3-pointer making it 66-65 with 51 seconds left. The total was one off his career best. Strawberry played despite learning of his maternal grandfather's death earlier Monday. Andrew Fishler scored nine and Desmond Ringer eight for Mercer. The win was Furman's 11th straight Southern Conference home victory.
